Rules governing the Honor Roll are:

" . . . that a Dean's Honor Roll be named for the Fall and the Spring semesters of the College of Law and that it shall include all students who earn a grade point average of not less than a 'B' (8.000) average of all courses taken and who were enrolled in at least 12 credit hours, nine of which are law letter graded. The required number of credit hours shall not include courses which the student is repeating or courses taken to eliminate an 'I'."

Further . . . for all dual degree candidates:

" . . . students in a dual degree program will qualify for the Honor Roll if they made a grade point average of 8.000 or better in no less than nine hours of graded law school work so long as they are enrolled in at least 12 hours of credit. The hours over the nine required may be either in law school, the Health Sciences Center, or on the Norman campus."
